p: Varying the value of α from 0.50 to 1.00, we examined the sensitivity of model parameters to differential virus shedding frequency between symptomatic and asymptomatic infections (Figure 4). When α gets smaller, both the risk of infection ( p) and the asymptomatic ratio ( s) were estimated to be greater. The probability of virus shedding among symptomatic cases remained stable (Figure 4C).
